*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_uploaad
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_upload .

  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ltyp_matkl_prdha,
      matnr TYPE matnr,
      matkl TYPE matkl,
      prdha TYPE prodh_d,
    END OF ltyp_matkl_prdha.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS:
    <lfs_out> LIKE LINE OF gt_out.

  DATA:
    lt_import      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gtyp_imp_exp,
    ls_import      TYPE gtyp_imp_exp,
    ls_import_ini  TYPE gtyp_imp_exp_ini,
    lt_filetable   TYPE filetable,
    ls_filetable   TYPE file_table,
    lt_csv         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string,
    ls_csv         TYPE string,
    lt_assign      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF v_t001k_assign WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY werks,
    ls_assign      TYPE v_t001k_assign,
    lt_ta_01       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_ariba_ta_01 WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY bukrs,
    ls_ta_01       TYPE zmm_ariba_ta_01,
    lt_ta_03       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_ariba_ta_03 WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY werks lgort,
    ls_ta_03       TYPE zmm_ariba_ta_03,
    lt_ta_12       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_ariba_ta_12 WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY bukrs werks,
    ls_ta_12       TYPE zmm_ariba_ta_12,
    lt_consumos    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_consumos WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY werks lgort,
    ls_consumos    TYPE zmm_consumos,
    lt_matkl_prdha TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ltyp_matkl_prdha WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY matnr,
    ls_matkl_prdha TYPE ltyp_matkl_prdha,
    lv_prdha       TYPE prodh_d,
    lv_filename    TYPE string,
    lv_rows        TYPE int4,
    lv_tabix       TYPE sytabix,
    lv_rc          TYPE i.

  FREE: gt_out.
  CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title            = 'Importar CSV'
      default_extension       = 'CSV'
      default_filename        = '*.CSV'
      file_filter             = '*.CSV'
      multiselection          = abap_false
    CHANGING
      file_table              = lt_filetable
      rc                      = lv_rc
    EXCEPTIONS
      file_open_dialog_failed = 1
      cntl_error              = 2
      error_no_gui            = 3
      not_supported_by_gui    = 4
      OTHERS                  = 5.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    FREE: lt_filetable.
  ENDIF.



  IF lt_filetable IS NOT INITIAL.
    READ TABLE lt_filetable INTO ls_filetable INDEX 1.
    lv_filename = ls_filetable.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_UPLOAD'
      EXPORTING
        filename                = lv_filename
        filetype                = 'ASC'
        has_field_separator     = abap_true
        read_by_line            = 'X'
      TABLES
        data_tab                = lt_csv
      EXCEPTIONS
        file_open_error         = 1
        file_read_error         = 2
        no_batch                = 3
        gui_refuse_filetransfer = 4
        invalid_type            = 5
        no_authority            = 6
        unknown_error           = 7
        bad_data_format         = 8
        header_not_allowed      = 9
        separator_not_allowed   = 10
        header_too_long         = 11
        unknown_dp_error        = 12
        access_denied           = 13
        dp_out_of_memory        = 14
        disk_full               = 15
        dp_timeout              = 16
        OTHERS                  = 17.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.


    FREE: lt_import.
    LOOP AT lt_csv INTO ls_csv.
      FREE: ls_import, ls_import_ini.
      IF sy-tabix = 1.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix - 1.
      SPLIT ls_csv AT ';' INTO ls_import_ini-matnr ls_import_ini-menge ls_import_ini-werks
                               ls_import_ini-lgort ls_import_ini-lfdat ls_import_ini-flief.

      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-matnr ) > 18.
        ls_import-matnr = ls_import_ini-matnr(18).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-matnr = ls_import_ini-matnr.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-menge ) > 16.
        ls_import-menge = ls_import_ini-menge(16).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-menge = ls_import_ini-menge.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-werks ) > 4.
        ls_import-werks = ls_import_ini-werks(4).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-werks = ls_import_ini-werks.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-lgort ) > 4.
        ls_import-lgort = ls_import_ini-lgort(4).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-lgort = ls_import_ini-lgort.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-lfdat ) > 10.
        ls_import_ini-lfdat = ls_import_ini-lfdat(10).
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-flief ) > 10.
        ls_import-flief = ls_import_ini-flief(10).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-flief = ls_import_ini-flief.
      ENDIF.
      TRANSLATE ls_import-menge  USING ',.'.
      IF zcl_mm_generic=>check_numeric( ls_import-menge ) IS NOT INITIAL.
        FREE: gs_num_errors.
        gs_num_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_num_errors-value = ls_import_ini-menge.
        APPEND gs_num_errors TO gt_num_errors.
        FREE: ls_import-menge.
      ENDIF.
      IF ls_import_ini-lfdat IS INITIAL.
        FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
        gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
        APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
      ELSEIF zcl_mm_generic=>check_date( ls_import_ini-lfdat ) IS INITIAL.
        CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERT_DATE_TO_INTERNAL'
          EXPORTING
            date_external            = ls_import_ini-lfdat
*           ACCEPT_INITIAL_DATE      =
          IMPORTING
            date_internal            = ls_import-lfdat
          EXCEPTIONS
            date_external_is_invalid = 1
            OTHERS                   = 2.
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          FREE: ls_import-lfdat.
          FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
          gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
          gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
          APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
        ENDIF.
      ELSE.
        FREE: ls_import-lfdat.
        FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
        gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
        APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND ls_import TO lt_import.
    ENDLOOP.


    FREE: gt_out.
    CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.

    gt_out = CORRESPONDING #( lt_import ).
    gt_out_ini = gt_out.

    CALL FUNCTION 'VIEW_GET_DATA'
      EXPORTING
        view_name              = 'V_T001K_ASSIGN'
      TABLES
        data                   = lt_assign
      EXCEPTIONS
        no_viewmaint_tool      = 1
        no_authority           = 2
        no_auth_for_sel        = 3
        data_access_restricted = 4
        no_functiongroup       = 5
        OTHERS                 = 6.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      FREE: lt_assign.
    ENDIF.

    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_01 INTO TABLE lt_ta_01 WHERE action = '01'.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_03 INTO TABLE lt_ta_03.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_12 INTO TABLE lt_ta_12.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_consumos    INTO TABLE lt_consumos.

    IF gt_out IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT gt_out ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_out>).
        CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MATN1_INPUT'
              EXPORTING
                input         = <ls_out>-matnr
              IMPORTING
                output        = <ls_out>-matnr.
      ENDLOOP.

      SELECT matnr matkl prdha
        INTO TABLE lt_matkl_prdha
        FROM mara
         FOR ALL ENTRIES IN gt_out
       WHERE matnr = gt_out-matnr.
    ENDIF.

    FREE: gt_post.
    LOOP AT gt_out INTO gs_out.
      MOVE-CORRESPONDING gs_out TO gs_post.
      gs_post-ernam = sy-uname.
      READ TABLE lt_assign WITH KEY werks = gs_post-werks
                           INTO ls_assign .
      IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
        READ TABLE lt_ta_01 WITH TABLE KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                            INTO ls_ta_01.
        IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
          gs_post-bsart = ls_ta_01-bbsrt.
          READ TABLE lt_matkl_prdha WITH TABLE KEY matnr = gs_post-matnr
                                    INTO ls_matkl_prdha.
          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            READ TABLE lt_ta_12 WITH KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                                         werks = gs_post-werks
                                         prodh = ls_matkl_prdha-prdha
                                INTO ls_ta_12.
            IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
              gs_post-knttp = ls_ta_12-knttp.
            ELSE.
              READ TABLE lt_ta_12 WITH KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                                         prodh = ls_matkl_prdha-prdha
                                INTO ls_ta_12.
              IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                gs_post-knttp = ls_ta_12-knttp.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.
            IF gs_post-knttp = 'K'.
              READ TABLE lt_consumos WITH KEY werks = gs_post-werks
                                              lgort = gs_post-lgort
                                     INTO ls_consumos.
              IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                gs_post-kostl = ls_consumos-kostl_c.
              ENDIF.
              CLEAR gs_post-ekorg. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/02025)
              LOOP AT lt_ta_03 INTO ls_ta_03 WHERE werks = gs_post-werks
                                               AND lgort = gs_post-lgort
                                               AND low_id_cat <= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl
                                               AND high_id_cat >= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl.
                gs_post-ekorg = ls_ta_03-ekorg.
                gs_post-ekgrp = ls_ta_03-ekgrp.
                EXIT.
              ENDLOOP.
              IF gs_post-ekorg IS INITIAL.
                LOOP AT lt_ta_03 INTO ls_ta_03 WHERE werks = gs_post-werks
                                               AND low_id_cat <= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl
                                               AND high_id_cat >= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl.
                  gs_post-ekorg = ls_ta_03-ekorg.
                  gs_post-ekgrp = ls_ta_03-ekgrp.
                  EXIT.
                ENDLOOP.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND gs_post TO gt_post.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDIF.


ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_download
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_download .

  DATA:
    lt_converted  TYPE  truxs_t_text_data,
    lt_converted1 TYPE  truxs_t_text_data,
    ls_converted  LIKE LINE OF lt_converted,
    lv_filename   TYPE string,
    lv_path       TYPE string,
    lv_fullpath   TYPE string.


  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_save_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title              = 'Exportar CSV'
      default_extension         = 'CSV'
      default_file_name         = '*.CSV'
      file_filter               = '*.CSV'
      prompt_on_overwrite       = 'X'
    CHANGING
      filename                  = lv_filename
      path                      = lv_path
      fullpath                  = lv_fullpath
    EXCEPTIONS
      cntl_error                = 1
      error_no_gui              = 2
      not_supported_by_gui      = 3
      invalid_default_file_name = 4
      OTHERS                    = 5.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    FREE: lv_filename , lv_path, lv_fullpath.
  ENDIF.

  IF lv_fullpath IS NOT INITIAL.

    ls_converted = 'C√≥digo do Material;Quantidade;Centro;Dep√≥sito;Data de Remessa;Fornecedor Fixo'.
    APPEND ls_converted TO lt_converted.
    APPEND LINES OF lt_converted1 TO lt_converted.

    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
      EXPORTING
*       BIN_FILESIZE            =
        filename                = lv_fullpath
*       FILETYPE                = 'ASC'
      TABLES
        data_tab                = lt_converted
*       FIELDNAMES              =
      EXCEPTIONS
        file_write_error        = 1
        no_batch                = 2
        gui_refuse_filetransfer = 3
        invalid_type            = 4
        no_authority            = 5
        unknown_error           = 6
        header_not_allowed      = 7
        separator_not_allowed   = 8
        filesize_not_allowed    = 9
        header_too_long         = 10
        dp_error_create         = 11
        dp_error_send           = 12
        dp_error_write          = 13
        unknown_dp_error        = 14
        access_denied           = 15
        dp_out_of_memory        = 16
        disk_full               = 17
        dp_timeout              = 18
        file_not_found          = 19
        dataprovider_exception  = 20
        control_flush_error     = 21
        OTHERS                  = 22.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* Implement suitable error handling here
    ENDIF.

  ENDIF.

ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_add_row
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_add_row .

  DATA:
    ls_out    TYPE zmm_log_st03,
    lv_new_id TYPE zmm_id,
    lv_lines  TYPE i.

  DESCRIBE TABLE gt_out LINES lv_lines.
  lv_new_id = lv_lines + 1.

  FREE: ls_out.
*  ls_out-id = lv_new_id.
  APPEND ls_out TO gt_out.


ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_insert_row
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& text
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      --> LV_INDEX
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_insert_row  USING pv_index TYPE i.

  DATA:
    gt_out1   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_log_st03,
    ls_out    TYPE zmm_log_st03,
    lv_new_id TYPE  zmm_id.


  FREE: gt_out1.
  LOOP AT gt_out INTO ls_out.
    IF sy-tabix = pv_index.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
    APPEND ls_out TO gt_out1.
  ENDLOOP.

*  lv_new_id = ls_out-id.
  FREE: ls_out.
*  ls_out-id = lv_new_id.
  APPEND ls_out TO gt_out1.

  LOOP AT gt_out INTO ls_out FROM pv_index.
*    ls_out-id = ls_out-id + 1.
    APPEND ls_out TO gt_out1.
  ENDLOOP.

  gt_out = gt_out1.

  CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.


ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_del_rows
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& text
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      --> LT_ROWS
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_del_rows  USING pt_rows TYPE lvc_t_row.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS:
    <lfs_out> TYPE zmm_log_st03.

  DATA:
    ls_rows TYPE lvc_s_row.

  SORT pt_rows BY index DESCENDING.
  LOOP AT pt_rows INTO ls_rows.
    DELETE gt_out INDEX ls_rows-index.
  ENDLOOP.

*  LOOP AT gt_out ASSIGNING <lfs_out>.
*    <lfs_out>-id = sy-tabix.
*  ENDLOOP.

  CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.

ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_post
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_post .

  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ltyp_keys,
      bsart TYPE bbsrt,
      ekorg TYPE ekorg,
      ekgrp TYPE ekgrp,
      werks TYPE werks_d,
    END OF ltyp_keys.

  DATA:
    BEGIN: OF lt_excl OCCURS 0,
      code TYPE syst_ucomm,
    END OF lt_excl.

  DATA:
    lt_keys       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ltyp_keys,
    ls_keys       TYPE ltyp_keys,
    ls_out        TYPE zmm_log_st03,
    lt_rows       TYPE lvc_t_row,
    lt_pritem	    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemimp,
    ls_pritem	    TYPE bapimereqitemimp,
    lt_pritemx    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemx,
    ls_pritemx    TYPE bapimereqitemx,
    lt_praccount  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqaccount,
    ls_praccount  TYPE bapimereqaccount,
    lt_praccountx TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqaccountx,
    ls_praccountx TYPE bapimereqaccountx,
    lt_return     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2,
    ls_return	    TYPE bapiret2,
    ls_prheader   TYPE bapimereqheader,
    ls_prheaderx  TYPE bapimereqheaderx,
    ls_code       TYPE bapi2017_gm_code,
    lv_number	    TYPE banfn,
    lv_msg        TYPE char200,
    lv_error      TYPE xfeld,
    lv_posted     TYPE i,
    lv_posted_c   TYPE char10,
    lv_items      TYPE i,
    lv_items_c    TYPE char10,
    lv_tabix      TYPE sytabix,
    lv_lines      TYPE i,
    lt_itemsource TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF BAPIMEREQSOURCE.


  CALL METHOD go_alv->get_selected_rows
    IMPORTING
      et_index_rows = lt_rows.

  IF lt_rows IS INITIAL.
    MESSAGE s194(zmm) DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.

  DESCRIBE TABLE gt_post LINES lv_lines.
  lv_tabix = lv_lines.
  DO lv_lines TIMES.
    READ TABLE lt_rows WITH KEY index = lv_tabix
                       TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
    IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE gt_post INDEX lv_tabix.
    ENDIF.
    SUBTRACT 1 FROM lv_tabix.
  ENDDO.

  CALL FUNCTION 'POPUP_CONTINUE_YES_NO'
    EXPORTING
      defaultoption = 'N'
      textline1     = 'Prosseguir?'(t07)
      textline2     = ' '
      titel         = 'Confirma√ß√£o'(t05)
      start_column  = 25
      start_row     = 6
    IMPORTING
      answer        = gv_answer.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    FREE gv_answer.
  ENDIF.
  IF gv_answer <> 'J'.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.


  lt_keys = CORRESPONDING #( gt_post ).

  SORT lt_keys.
  DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_keys.

  FREE: lt_excl.
  APPEND '&POST' TO lt_excl.
  SET PF-STATUS 'STLI' EXCLUDING lt_excl.
  LEAVE TO LIST-PROCESSING.

  DATA lv_count TYPE i. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)

  FREE: lv_posted, lv_posted_c, lv_items, lv_items_c.
  LOOP AT lt_keys INTO ls_keys.

    FREE: ls_prheader, ls_prheaderx, lt_pritem, lt_pritemx, lt_praccount, lt_praccountx.

    ls_prheader-pr_type = ls_keys-bsart.
    ls_prheaderx-pr_type = abap_true.

* EXT_DSMF (10/10/2025) - START - issue #482
    ls_prheader-auto_source = 'X'.
    ls_prheaderx-auto_source = abap_true.
* END


    lv_count = 1. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)

    LOOP AT gt_post INTO gs_post WHERE bsart = ls_keys-bsart
                                   AND ekorg = ls_keys-ekorg
                                   AND ekgrp = ls_keys-ekgrp
                                   AND werks = ls_keys-werks.
      FREE: ls_pritem, ls_pritemx, ls_praccount, ls_praccountx.

      "ls_pritem-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_pritem-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
*      ls_pritem-purch_org = ls_keys-ekorg.
      ls_pritem-pur_group = gs_post-ekgrp.
      ls_pritem-preq_name = gs_post-ernam.
      ls_pritem-acctasscat = gs_post-knttp.
      ls_pritem-material = gs_post-matnr.
      ls_pritem-plant = gs_post-werks.
      ls_pritem-store_loc = gs_post-lgort. " EXT_DMSF (22/08/2025) - ignorar o Dep√≥sito (validar apenas o Centro)
      ls_pritem-quantity = gs_post-menge.
      ls_pritem-preq_date = sy-datum. " EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - atualiza√ß√£o da data de solicita√ß√£o
      ls_pritem-deliv_date = gs_post-lfdat. " EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - atualiza√ß√£o da data de remessa do item
*      ls_pritem-fixed_vend = gs_post-flief.

* EXT_DMSF (16/10/2025) - START
      SELECT meins INTO @DATA(lv_pounit)
        FROM mara
        WHERE matnr = @GS_post-matnr.
      ENDSELECT.

      ls_pritem-po_unit = lv_pounit.
      ls_pritem-po_unit_iso = lv_pounit.
* END

      IF ls_pritem-fixed_vend IS NOT INITIAL.
        UNPACK ls_pritem-fixed_vend TO ls_pritem-fixed_vend.
      ENDIF.

      "ls_pritemx-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_pritemx-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
*      ls_pritemx-purch_org = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-pur_group = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-preq_name = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-acctasscat = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-material = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-plant = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-store_loc = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (22/08/2025) - ignorar o Dep√≥sito (validar apenas o Centro)
      ls_pritemx-quantity = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-preq_date = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-deliv_date = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - atualiza√ß√£o da data de remessa do item
*      ls_pritemx-fixed_vend = abap_true.

      ls_pritemx-po_unit = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (16/10/2025)
      ls_pritemx-po_unit_iso = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (16/10/2025)

      APPEND:
        ls_pritem  TO lt_pritem,
        ls_pritemx TO lt_pritemx.
      " NS - 16/09/2025 - Begin - Fix error ME 083 Enter cost center
      IF ls_pritem-distrib IS INITIAL.
        ls_praccount-serial_no = '01'.
        ls_praccountx-serial_no = '01'.
        ls_praccountx-serial_nox = abap_true.
      ENDIF.
      " NS - 16/09/2025 - End
      "ls_praccount-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_praccount-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
      ls_praccount-costcenter = gs_post-kostl.
      "ls_praccountx-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_praccountx-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
      ls_praccountx-costcenter = abap_true.
      APPEND:
        ls_praccount TO lt_praccount,
        ls_praccountx TO lt_praccountx.

      lv_count = lv_count + 1. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
    ENDLOOP.

    CONCATENATE '->' ls_keys-bsart ls_keys-ekorg ls_keys-ekgrp ls_keys-werks INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
    WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 3.

    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PR_CREATE'
      EXPORTING
        prheader   = ls_prheader
        prheaderx  = ls_prheaderx
*       TESTRUN    =
      IMPORTING
        number     = lv_number
*       PRHEADEREXP                  =
      TABLES
        return     = lt_return
        pritem     = lt_pritem
        pritemx    = lt_pritemx
*       PRITEMEXP  =
        pritemsource = lt_itemsource
        praccount  = lt_praccount
*       PRACCOUNTPROITSEGMENT        =
        praccountx = lt_praccountx
*       PRADDRDELIVERY               =
*       PRITEMTEXT =
*       PRHEADERTEXT                 =
*       EXTENSIONIN                  =
*       EXTENSIONOUT                 =
*       PRVERSION  =
*       PRVERSIONX =
*       ALLVERSIONS                  =
*       PRCOMPONENTS                 =
*       PRCOMPONENTSX                =
*       SERVICEOUTLINE               =
*       SERVICEOUTLINEX              =
*       SERVICELINES                 =
*       SERVICELINESX                =
*       SERVICELIMIT                 =
*       SERVICELIMITX                =
*       SERVICECONTRACTLIMITS        =
*       SERVICECONTRACTLIMITSX       =
*       SERVICEACCOUNT               =
*       SERVICEACCOUNTX              =
*       SERVICELONGTEXTS             =
*       SERIALNUMBER                 =
*       SERIALNUMBERX                =
      .

    FREE: lv_msg, lv_error.
    DELETE lt_return WHERE id = 'BAPI'.
    SORT lt_return.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_return.
    SORT lt_return BY type.
    LOOP AT lt_return INTO ls_return.
      FREE: lv_msg.
      IF ls_return-row IS NOT INITIAL.
        WRITE ls_return-row TO lv_msg LEFT-JUSTIFIED.
        CONCATENATE 'Linha:' lv_msg INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
      ENDIF.
      IF lv_msg IS NOT INITIAL.
        CONCATENATE lv_msg '=>' ls_return-type ls_return-id ls_return-number ls_return-message
                    INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
      ELSE.
        CONCATENATE ls_return-type ls_return-id ls_return-number ls_return-message
                    INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
      ENDIF.
      IF ls_return-type = 'E' OR ls_return-type = 'A'.
        lv_error = abap_true.
        WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 6.
      ELSE.
        WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 2.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lv_error IS INITIAL.
      ADD 1 TO lv_posted.
      DESCRIBE TABLE lt_pritem LINES lv_lines.
      ADD lv_lines TO lv_items.
      CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
        EXPORTING
          wait = abap_true.

* EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - START - Implementa√ß√£o Cap 3.3

      DATA: lt_erev TYPE TABLE OF erev,
            ls_erev TYPE erev.

      SELECT * FROM erev
        INTO TABLE lt_erev
        WHERE edokn = lv_number.

      LOOP AT lt_erev INTO ls_erev.

        ls_erev-revno = '0'.
        ls_erev-revok = 'X'.

        MODIFY erev FROM ls_erev.

      ENDLOOP.

      DELETE FROM erev WHERE edokn = lv_number AND revok <> 'X'.

      UPDATE eban
        SET banpr = '02'
        WHERE banfn = lv_number.

* END

* EXT_DMSF (21/10/2025) - START

      DATA:
            lt_selectresults TYPE TABLE OF eban,
            ls_selectresult TYPE eban,
            ls_temppritem TYPE bapimereqitemimp,
            lv_flief TYPE flief,
            ls_prheaderxp TYPE BAPIMEREQHEADER,
            lt_returnchange TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2,
            lt_pritemchange	TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemimp,
            ls_pritemchange TYPE bapimereqitemimp,
            lt_pritemxchange TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemx,
            ls_pritemxchange TYPE bapimereqitemx.

      SELECT * INTO TABLE lt_selectresults
        FROM eban
        WHERE banfn = lv_number.

      LOOP AT lt_pritem INTO ls_temppritem.

        READ TABLE lt_selectresults INTO ls_selectresult
          WITH KEY bnfpo = ls_temppritem-preq_item.

        IF sy-subrc = 0.

          lv_flief = gt_post[ ls_temppritem-preq_item ]-flief.
          lv_flief = |{ lv_flief ALPHA = IN }|.

          IF ls_selectresult-flief <> lv_flief.

            ls_pritemchange-preq_item = ls_temppritem-preq_item.
            ls_pritemchange-fixed_vend = lv_flief.
            ls_pritemchange-agreement = ''.
            ls_pritemchange-agmt_item = ''.
            ls_pritemchange-info_rec = ''.
            APPEND ls_pritemchange TO lt_pritemchange.

            ls_pritemxchange-preq_item = ls_temppritem-preq_item.
            ls_pritemxchange-fixed_vend = abap_true.
            ls_pritemxchange-agreement = abap_true.
            ls_pritemxchange-agmt_item = abap_true.
            ls_pritemxchange-info_rec = abap_true.
            APPEND ls_pritemxchange TO lt_pritemxchange.

            CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PR_CHANGE'
              EXPORTING
                number = lv_number
              IMPORTING
                prheaderexp = ls_prheaderxp
              TABLES
                return = lt_returnchange
                pritem = lt_pritemchange
                pritemx = lt_pritemxchange.
          ENDIF.

        ENDIF.

      ENDLOOP.

      CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
        EXPORTING
          wait = abap_true.

* END

      FREE: lv_msg.
      MESSAGE ID 'ZMM' TYPE 'S' NUMBER 196 WITH lv_number INTO lv_msg.
      WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 2.
    ENDIF.

  ENDLOOP.


  IF lv_posted > 0.
    WRITE lv_posted TO lv_posted_c LEFT-JUSTIFIED.
    WRITE lv_items  TO lv_items_c  LEFT-JUSTIFIED.
    MESSAGE s193(zmm) WITH lv_posted_c lv_items_c.
  ENDIF.
  SET SCREEN 0.
  LEAVE SCREEN.

ENDFORM.

This program significantly reduces manual effort, improves data quality, and ensures consistency when creating large volumes of Purchase Requisitions. If anyone has implemented similar tools or has suggestions for enhancements, I‚Äôd be happy to discuss ideas!

Thanks for reading! üëã

entry.title: ‚ÄúDynamic Table Transposition in ABAP Using RTTS: A Utility-Based Approach‚Äù
entry.content:
Introduction:-

In complex SAP data processing scenarios, there is often a need to transpose data between row-oriented and column-oriented structures. This blog introduces a generic utility in ABAP that performs dynamic table transposition using RTTS (Run-Time Type Services). 

While ABAP doesn't provide a native statement like PIVOT, we can use RTTS (RunTime Type Services) to achieve a clean, reusable utility that handles dynamic transposition. 

This utility provides a way to transpose data between rows ‚Üí columns and columns ‚Üí rows, based on flexible input. It leverages RTTS (Run-Time Type Services) to create dynamic internal tables at runtime. 

Objective:-

Create a flexible, reusable ABAP utility that can: 

  • Convert row-based input into a column-based dynamic internal table. 
  • Convert it back from column to row format. 
  • Use RTTS to handle any number of fields without hardcoding. 

Use Case:-

Imagine this internal table:-

ROW 

FIELD 

VALUE 

1 

MATNR 

1001 

1 

MAKTX 

Material A 

1 

AMOUNT 

200.50 

2 

MATNR 

2002 

2 

MAKTX 

Material B 

2 

AMOUNT 

350.00 

We want to transpose this into:-

ROW 

MATNR 

MAKTX 

AMOUNT 

1 

1001 

Material A 

200.50 

2 

2002 

Material B 

350.00 

Code implementation--

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report ZBRT_RP_RTT_SCN
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT zbrt_rp_rtt_scn.

*Purpose  : Utility to transpose Internal Table -
*            Row to Column and Column to Row

INTERFACE zif_transposer.
  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ty_rows,
      row    TYPE i,
      field  TYPE char30,
      dename TYPE char30,
      value  TYPE string,
    END   OF ty_rows.
  TYPES: tt_rows TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_rows.

  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ty_fields,
      field  TYPE char30,
      dename TYPE char30,
    END   OF ty_fields.
  TYPES: tt_fields TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_fields.

  METHODS:
    transpose
      RETURNING VALUE(ro_data) TYPE REF TO data.

  DATA: t_fields     TYPE tt_fields,
        t_data       TYPE tt_rows,
        o_dyna_table TYPE REF TO data,
        o_dyna_wa    TYPE REF TO data.

  METHODS: create_dynamic_table,
    collect_fields.

ENDINTERFACE.                    "zif_transposer

CLASS zcl_transpose_to_columns DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES: zif_transposer.
    METHODS:
      constructor
        IMPORTING
          it_data   TYPE zif_transposer=>tt_rows
          it_fields TYPE zif_transposer=>tt_fields OPTIONAL.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    ALIASES: t_data   FOR zif_transposer~t_data,
             t_fields FOR zif_transposer~t_fields,
             o_dyna_table FOR zif_transposer~o_dyna_table,
             o_dyna_wa    FOR zif_transposer~o_dyna_wa.


ENDCLASS.                    "zcl_transpose_to_columns DEFINITION

CLASS zcl_transpose_to_rows DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES: zif_transposer.
    METHODS:
      constructor
        IMPORTING
          it_data   TYPE ANY TABLE
          it_fields TYPE zif_transposer=>tt_fields OPTIONAL.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    ALIASES: t_data       FOR zif_transposer~t_data,
             t_fields     FOR zif_transposer~t_fields,
             o_dyna_table FOR zif_transposer~o_dyna_table,
             o_dyna_wa    FOR zif_transposer~o_dyna_wa.

ENDCLASS.                    "zcl_transpose_to_rows DEFINITION

CLASS zcl_transpose_to_columns IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD constructor.
    t_data   = it_data.
    t_fields = it_fields.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "constructor
  METHOD zif_transposer~transpose.
    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <f_tab>   TYPE STANDARD TABLE,
      <f_wa>    TYPE any,
      <f_field> TYPE any.
    DATA: ls_data LIKE LINE OF me->t_data.

*   create dynamic table
    me->zif_transposer~collect_fields( ).
    me->zif_transposer~create_dynamic_table( ).

*   Move data to Dynamica table
    ASSIGN o_dyna_table->*  TO <f_tab>.
    ASSIGN o_dyna_wa->*     TO <f_wa>.

    LOOP AT me->t_data INTO ls_data.
      ASSIGN COMPONENT ls_data-field OF STRUCTURE <f_wa> TO <f_field>.
      IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
        <f_field> = ls_data-value.
      ENDIF.
      AT END OF row.
        APPEND <f_wa> TO <f_tab>.
        CLEAR  <f_wa>.
      ENDAT.
    ENDLOOP.
*   send data back
    ro_data = o_dyna_table.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "zif_transposer~transpose

  METHOD zif_transposer~create_dynamic_table.

    DATA: lo_struct   TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr,
          lo_element  TYPE REF TO cl_abap_elemdescr,
          lo_new_type TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr,
          lo_new_tab  TYPE REF TO cl_abap_tabledescr,
          lt_comp     TYPE cl_abap_structdescr=>component_table,
          lt_tot_comp TYPE cl_abap_structdescr=>component_table,
          la_comp     LIKE LINE OF lt_comp.

    DATA: ls_field LIKE LINE OF me->t_fields,
          lv_name  TYPE string.

    LOOP AT me->t_fields INTO ls_field.
      IF ls_field-dename IS INITIAL.
        lv_name = ls_field-field.
      ELSE.
        lv_name = ls_field-dename.
      ENDIF.

*   Element Description
      lo_element ?= cl_abap_elemdescr=>describe_by_name( lv_name ).

*   Components
      la_comp-name = ls_field-field.
      la_comp-type = lo_element.
      APPEND la_comp TO lt_tot_comp.
      CLEAR: la_comp.
    ENDLOOP.

*   Create a New Type
    lo_new_type = cl_abap_structdescr=>create( lt_tot_comp ).

*   New Table type
    lo_new_tab = cl_abap_tabledescr=>create(
                    p_line_type  = lo_new_type
                    p_table_kind = cl_abap_tabledescr=>tablekind_std
                    p_unique     = abap_false ).

*   data to handle the new table type
    CREATE DATA : o_dyna_table TYPE HANDLE lo_new_tab,
                  o_dyna_wa    TYPE HANDLE lo_new_type.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "create_dynamic_table
  METHOD zif_transposer~collect_fields.

    CHECK t_fields IS INITIAL.

    DATA: lv_first_field TYPE char30,
          ls_data        LIKE LINE OF me->t_data,
          ls_field       LIKE LINE OF me->t_fields.

    LOOP AT me->t_data INTO ls_data.
      IF lv_first_field = ls_data-field.
        EXIT.
      ENDIF.
      IF lv_first_field IS INITIAL.
        lv_first_field = ls_data-field.
      ENDIF.
      MOVE-CORRESPONDING ls_data TO ls_field.
      APPEND ls_field TO me->t_fields.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "collect_Fields
ENDCLASS.                    "zcl_transpose_to_columns IMPLEMENTATION

*
CLASS zcl_transpose_to_rows IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD constructor.
    GET REFERENCE OF it_data INTO o_dyna_table.
    t_fields = it_fields.
  ENDMETHOD.                    "constructor

  METHOD zif_transposer~transpose.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <f_tab>   TYPE STANDARD TABLE,
      <f_wa>    TYPE any,
      <f_field> TYPE any.

    DATA: lt_rows   TYPE zif_transposer=>tt_rows,
          ls_rows   LIKE LINE OF lt_rows,
          lv_row    TYPE i,
          ls_fields LIKE LINE OF t_fields.

    me->zif_transposer~collect_fields( ).
    me->zif_transposer~create_dynamic_table( ).

    ASSIGN o_dyna_table->* TO <f_tab>.

    LOOP AT <f_tab> ASSIGNING <f_wa>.
      lv_row = sy-tabix.

      LOOP AT t_fields INTO ls_fields.

        ASSIGN COMPONENT ls_fields-field OF STRUCTURE <f_wa> TO <f_field>.
        IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
          ls_rows-row   = lv_row.
          ls_rows-field = ls_fields-field.
          ls_rows-dename = ls_fields-dename.
          ls_rows-value  = <f_field>.
          APPEND ls_rows TO lt_rows.
        ENDIF.

      ENDLOOP.

    ENDLOOP.

    me->t_data = lt_rows.
    GET REFERENCE OF me->t_data INTO ro_data.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "zif_transposer~transpose

  METHOD zif_transposer~create_dynamic_table.

*   Setting up the o_dyna_wa is unnecessary, just sake of completeness
*   of this method
    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <f_tab> TYPE STANDARD TABLE,
      <f_wa>  TYPE any.

    ASSIGN o_dyna_table->* TO <f_tab>.
    READ TABLE <f_tab> ASSIGNING <f_wa> INDEX 1.
    IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
      GET REFERENCE OF <f_wa> INTO o_dyna_wa.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "zif_transposer~create_dynamic_table

  METHOD zif_transposer~collect_fields.

    DATA: lo_tab    TYPE REF TO cl_abap_tabledescr,
          lo_struc  TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr,
          lt_comp   TYPE cl_abap_structdescr=>component_table,
          ls_comp   LIKE LINE OF lt_comp,
          ls_fields LIKE LINE OF t_fields.

    IF t_fields IS INITIAL.
      lo_tab ?= cl_abap_tabledescr=>describe_by_data_ref( o_dyna_table ).
      lo_struc ?= lo_tab->get_table_line_type( ).
      lt_comp = lo_struc->get_components( ).

      LOOP AT lt_comp INTO ls_comp.
        ls_fields-field = ls_comp-name.
        ls_fields-dename = ls_comp-type->get_relative_name( ).
        APPEND ls_fields TO t_fields.
      ENDLOOP.

    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "zif_transposer~collect_fields
ENDCLASS.                    "zcl_transpose_to_rows IMPLEMENTATION


*Demo Program
*Here is the simple demo program to test the utility class

START-OF-SELECTION.
* test data
  DATA: lt_rows TYPE zif_transposer=>tt_rows,
        ls_rows LIKE LINE OF lt_rows.

  lt_rows = VALUE #(
    ( row = 1 field = 'MATNR' value = '1-234-123' )
    ( row = 1 field = 'MAKTX' value = 'Test Material 1' )
    ( row = 1 field = 'AMOUNT' dename = 'DMBTR' value = '123.45' )
    ( row = 2 field = 'MATNR' value = '9-123-123' )
    ( row = 2 field = 'MAKTX' value = 'Assembly 123' )
  ).

* Transpose the data to columns
  DATA: lo_col_transposer TYPE REF TO zif_transposer,
        lo_col_data       TYPE REF TO data.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS:<f_output> TYPE STANDARD TABLE.

  CREATE OBJECT lo_col_transposer
    TYPE
    zcl_transpose_to_columns
    EXPORTING
      it_data = lt_rows.
  lo_col_data = lo_col_transposer->transpose( ).
  ASSIGN lo_col_data->* TO <f_output>.

  DATA: o_salv TYPE REF TO cl_salv_table.
  TRY.
      CALL METHOD cl_salv_table=>factory
        IMPORTING
          r_salv_table = o_salv
        CHANGING
          t_table      = <f_output>.
      o_salv->display( ).
    CATCH cx_salv_msg .
  ENDTRY.


* Transpose to rows
  DATA: lo_row_transposer TYPE REF TO zif_transposer,
        lo_row_data       TYPE REF TO data.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS: <lfs_row_tab> TYPE zif_transposer=>tt_rows.

  CREATE OBJECT lo_row_transposer
    TYPE
    zcl_transpose_to_rows
    EXPORTING
      it_data = <f_output>.
  lo_row_data = lo_row_transposer->transpose( ).
  ASSIGN lo_row_data->* TO <lfs_row_tab>.

  DATA: o_salv2 TYPE REF TO cl_salv_table.
  TRY.
      CALL METHOD cl_salv_table=>factory
        IMPORTING
          r_salv_table = o_salv2
        CHANGING
          t_table      = <lfs_row_tab>.
      o_salv2->display( ).
    CATCH cx_salv_msg .
  ENDTRY.

Key Components-- 

Interface ZIF_TRANSPOSER 

Defines shared structure and behavior:-

Types:-

  • TY_ROWS: For input/output row-style data. 
  • TY_FIELDS: Metadata about field names and domain names. 

Attributes:-

  • T_DATA: Holds row-wise data. 
  • T_FIELDS: Holds metadata. 
  • O_DYNA_TABLE, O_DYNA_WA: Dynamic table and work area.

Methods:-

  • TRANSPOSE: Main method to perform transformation. 
  • CREATE_DYNAMIC_TABLE: Creates dynamic internal table from metadata. 
  • COLLECT_FIELDS: Collects field metadata.

Class ZCL_TRANSPOSE_TO_COLUMNS

Purpose:-

Transpose row-oriented data into a column-based dynamic internal table. 

Implements row ‚Üí column transposition.

METHOD zif_transposer~transpose.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <f_tab>   TYPE STANDARD TABLE,
      <f_wa>    TYPE any,
      <f_field> TYPE any.
    DATA: ls_data LIKE LINE OF me->t_data.

*   create dynamic table
    me->zif_transposer~collect_fields( ).
    me->zif_transposer~create_dynamic_table( ).

*   Move data to Dynamica table
    ASSIGN o_dyna_table->*  TO <f_tab>.
    ASSIGN o_dyna_wa->*     TO <f_wa>.

    LOOP AT me->t_data INTO ls_data.
      ASSIGN COMPONENT ls_data-field OF STRUCTURE <f_wa> TO <f_field>.
      IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
        <f_field> = ls_data-value.
      ENDIF.
      AT END OF row.
        APPEND <f_wa> TO <f_tab>.
        CLEAR  <f_wa>.
      ENDAT.
    ENDLOOP.
*   send data back
    ro_data = o_dyna_table.
  ENDMETHOD.                    "zif_transposer~transpose

TRANSPOSE:-

Uses collect_fields and create_dynamic_table to prepare output table structure. 

Loops over t_data:-

  • Groups by ROW number. 
  • Assigns each value to its respective field in the dynamic work area. 
  • Appends when end of the row is reached.

Class ZCL_TRANSPOSE_TO_ROWS 

Purpose:-

Convert dynamic internal tables back into row-wise data. 

Implements column ‚Üí row transposition.

CLASS zcl_transpose_to_rows IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD constructor.
    GET REFERENCE OF it_data INTO o_dyna_table.
    t_fields = it_fields.
  ENDMETHOD.                    "constructor

  METHOD zif_transposer~transpose.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <f_tab>   TYPE STANDARD TABLE,
      <f_wa>    TYPE any,
      <f_field> TYPE any.
    DATA: lt_rows   TYPE zif_transposer=>tt_rows,
          ls_rows   LIKE LINE OF lt_rows,
          lv_row    TYPE i,
          ls_fields LIKE LINE OF t_fields.

    me->zif_transposer~collect_fields( ).
    me->zif_transposer~create_dynamic_table( ).

    ASSIGN o_dyna_table->* TO <f_tab>.
    LOOP AT <f_tab> ASSIGNING <f_wa>.
      lv_row = sy-tabix.

      LOOP AT t_fields INTO ls_fields.
        ASSIGN COMPONENT ls_fields-field OF STRUCTURE <f_wa> TO <f_field>.
        IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
          ls_rows-row   = lv_row.
          ls_rows-field = ls_fields-field.
          ls_rows-dename = ls_fields-dename.
          ls_rows-value  = <f_field>.
          APPEND ls_rows TO lt_rows.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.
    me->t_data = lt_rows.
    GET REFERENCE OF me->t_data INTO ro_data.

  ENDMETHOD.                    "zif_transposer~transpose

TRANSPOSE:-

Loops through dynamic table rows (<f_tab>). 

For each field in each row:-

  • Reads value via field-symbol.
  • Stores as row-wise t_data entries (tt_rows).

Helper Methods 

COLLECT_FIELDS

If no metadata was provided, derive field names and types: 

  • From row data (ZCL_TRANSPOSE_TO_COLUMNS).
  • Or from table structure via RTTS (ZCL_TRANSPOSE_TO_ROWS).

CREATE_DYNAMIC_TABLE:-

  • Uses cl_abap_structdescr and cl_abap_tabledescr to create table based on metadata. 
  • Stores the table and line reference in o_dyna_table, o_dyna_wa.

Sample Test Program:-

Input Data:-

Transpose to Columns:-

Transpose Back to Rows:-

Display via SALV:-

Let's execute it and see the result:-

After Rows to Columns.

After Columns to Rows, which is same as what we have started with the test data.

What Makes It Powerful:-

  • Generic ‚Üí No hardcoded structure. 
  • Reusable ‚Üí Accepts any row-format or table-format. 
  • Dynamic ‚Üí Fully uses RTTS (Run-Time Type Services). 
  • Extensible ‚Üí You can plug it into other data manipulation utilities or UI tools.

Conclusion:-

Dynamic data transposition is a common need in flexible reporting and interface design. By leveraging RTTS, this utility provides a powerful, generic, and elegant solution to this challenge. It abstracts away the technical complexity, offering a clean interface to both functional and technical consultants.

Thanks__

entry.title: Getting started with Joule-For ABAP Developers
entry.content:
Getting started with Joule-For ABAP Developers

Recently, I got the opportunity to attend a hands-on workshop session organized by SAP on Joule for developers.  The session covered its integration with SAP Build as well as ABAP. As I am into ABAP, here‚Äôs a quick startup blog on Joule for developers-ABAP. Let‚Äôs quickly get to the overview of Joule.

What is Joule?

Joule is an AI copilot inside SAP, that understands normal conversations, so it‚Äôs your smart coworker in SAP that operates on cloud (BTP) and can help in fetching quick data, generating reports and even suggesting code or code modifications, which in turn makes your life much easier.

Key Features:

  • Conversational Interface
  • Integration with SAP Apps
  • Enterprise Ready
  • Tailored for your business
  • Automatic updates
  • Create custom package

Benefits:

  • Faster work
  • Smarter Insights
  • Better outcomes
  • Full control

With that overview in place, let's begin with how we can use Joule while working on the developments in Eclipse.

Add Joule in Eclipse

       1. Create Package

  • First step is to create a package using below steps:
  • In the cloud system in eclipse under Favourite packages, right click on ZLOCAL package.
  • Create a new sub package with your unique group id.
  •  Maintain the required information like package name and description and click next.
  • Next screen will display Package type, S/W component and Transport layer.
  • Select Package Type ‚ÄúDevelopment‚Äù and click ‚ÄúNext‚Äù.
  • Create/Select the required TR and click on ‚ÄúFinish‚Äù.
  • Package will get created.

          

        2. Create Artifacts

        Created Odata service from scratch for a travel application using        /DMO/TRAVEL_DATA and /DMO/BOOKING_DATA structures.  Steps are given below:

  • Right click on the package.
  • Select ‚ÄúGenerate ABAP Repository Objects‚Äù.

         

  • Select ‚ÄúOData UI service from scratch‚Äù.

       

  • Click ‚ÄòNext‚Äô and select the required package.
  • Click ‚ÄòNext‚Äô to finish and enable the joule.
  • Joule is now active and will be displayed on right side as shown below:

How to use Joule

We can give prompts for Joule to create objects in the system. For example, to create the application, paste the below prompt in Joule window:

‚ÄúCreate a transaction application for travel management. Create the entity Travel based on the structure /DMO/TRAVEL_DATA. The second entity is Booking based on /DMO/BOOKING_DATA. ‚Äú

Joule will respond by displaying the list of objects that will be created. If there are not further modifications, we can just click on ‚ÄúAccept‚Äù:

Then, click on next and select the previously created TR and click on ‚ÄúFinish‚Äù.

The application for travel management will get created and in the project explorer all the generated objects will get displayed:

We can also give further prompt to add new fields, or if we need any other modifications. Make sure to click Accept every time you are adding new objects. Also, before continuing and generating the RAP BO, make sure you check for all the required fields and objects in your data model.

Explaining Artifacts

Joule can even provide the details of the artifacts. So, if we need Joule to explain any of the objects,

  • Right click on the artifact that we want the details for, Select Joule->Explain.
  • Joule will be displayed on right with all the required explanation about the artifact selected.
  • Here one can ask further questions as well.

Notes:

Generated objects should always end with suffix ‚Äú###‚Äù (follow naming conventions)-replace ### with your group ID.

References:

SAP Help Portal

abap-platform-rap120/exercises/ex01/README.md at main ¬∑ SAP-samples/abap-platform-rap120 ¬∑ GitHub

entry.title: SAP on SQL Server 2025 with ODBC Driver 18: How to Implement the Encryption Requirements
entry.content:
With the release of SQL Server 2025, the SQL Server ODBC Driver version 18 is becoming more prevalent. ODBC Driver 18 introduces encryption by default, which has a crucial impact on SAP NetWeaver installations using SAP Software Provisioning Manager (SWPM).

There is some general guidance from Microsoft about this topic, but in this blog post, I‚Äôd like to outline the most basic way of configuring certificates on your hosts in more detail.

Note:
There are several ways to approach this, depending on your overall security concept. In this blog post, I describe what I consider the easiest method.

Context

ODBC Driver 18 requires encrypted connections, unlike its predecessor, Driver 17, where encryption is optional. This means you must configure certificates on your hosts to establish a secure connection from SWPM to the database.
Read on to learn the exact steps you need to take.

Step-by-Step: Configuring Certificates

1. Create a self-signed certificate:

Begin by generating a self-signed certificate on your database host using PowerShell:

a. At first, define the parameters for your certificate:

# Define parameters
$certificateParams = @{
    Type = "SSLServerAuthentication"
    Subject = "CN=$env:COMPUTERNAME"
    DnsName = @("$($env:COMPUTERNAME)", $([System.Net.Dns]::GetHostEntry('').HostName), 'localhost')
    KeyAlgorithm = "RSA"
    KeyLength = 2048
    HashAlgorithm = "SHA256"
    TextExtension = "2.5.29.37={text}1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1"
    NotAfter = (Get-Date).AddMonths(36)
    KeySpec = "KeyExchange"
    Provider = "Microsoft RSA SChannel Cryptographic Provider"
    CertStoreLocation = "cert:\LocalMachine\My"
}‚Äã

b. For distributed or high availability (HA) installations, add all other hosts and virtual names to the DnsName property:

# Add additional hosts for distributed or clustered installations:
$certificateParams.DnsName += "<additional host or virtual name>‚Äã"

Repeat this command for all other nodes, application server hosts, and the virtual name of the SQL Server, if it's clustered or you use Always On.

c. Then create the certificate with this command:

# Create the certificate:
$cert = New-SelfSignedCertificate @certificateParams‚Äã

 

2. Export and import the certificate:

a. Export the certificate and import it into the trusted root store:

# Set a password:
$certPassword = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "<password>" -Force -AsPlainText 
$path = "cert:\localMachine\my\" + $cert.thumbprint

# Export the certificate to your disk
Export-PfxCertificate -cert $path -FilePath "C:\windows\temp\SQLcert.pfx" -Force -Password $certPassword

# Import the certificate into root from the disk:
Import-PfxCertificate -FilePath "C:\windows\temp\SQLcert.pfx" -Password $certPassword -CertStoreLocation "Cert:\LocalMachine\Root"

Ensure you use a secure password and choose an appropriate export location.

b. For distributed or HA installations, copy the SQLcert.pfx file to all necessary hosts and import the certificate similarly.

3. Configure SQL Server to use the certificate:

  1. Access the SQL Server Configuration Manager on the database host and navigate to "SQL Server Network Configuration".
  2. Open the properties of the protocols for your instance.
  3. Select the self-signed certificate from the Certificates tab.
  4. Restart SQL Server for the changes to take effect.

Now that you have the required encryption certificates in place, you can establish a secure connection from SWPM to your SQL Server database.

Conclusion

While the mandatory encryption setting may seem daunting, following these steps will ensure a smooth transition to ODBC Driver 18 and secure connections. If you prefer, you can opt for ODBC Driver 17, which offers optional encryption.

entry.title: Understanding the Evolution of SAP SuccessFactors BizX Architecture
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I‚Äôd like to share some observations and implementation insights on the evolution of the SAP SuccessFactors BizX architecture.

I often receive similar questions from clients and junior consultants:

  • ‚ÄúSince data already exists in Employee Central, why can‚Äôt PMGM read it directly?‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúIf all modules are within SuccessFactors, why can‚Äôt RCM consume MDF data from EC‚Äîor send data back to EC?‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúWhy are Business Rules not available for Background Elements?‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúWhy does SuccessFactors have both Background Elements and MDF when they seem to serve similar purposes?‚Äù

Although in SAP marketing materials, EC is the foundation of all SF modules, it is not entirely the case. 

SF BizX architecture has involved overtime:

Phase 1: Original SF architecture: XML, route map, form based permission. (Prior to 2011 when SAP acquired SF)

  • Employee master data: UDF and background elements, trend information
  • Back then SF was a talent-focused system only. It consisted of PMGM (flagship module), SP, CDP, COMP, RCM. COMP module got enhanced overtime, it is perfectly integrated with EC and MDF. However, until 2H2025 PMGM, SP, CDP, RCM are still not truly integrated with EC or MDF. 

Phase 2: More framework was introduced (Foundation object, EC HRIS Element, Role based permission). (2011-2013 SAP built EC)

  • Employee master data: EC HRIS Element is added.
  • EC is built on top of UDF and syncs back to UDF. 

Phase 3: More framework was introduced (MDF, business rule, Role based permission). (2014 onwards)

  • Employee master data is now complete
    • UDF
    • HRIS Elements
    • Background Elements
    • Trend Elements
    • MDF (user transactional objects)
  • In 2015, SAP announced that all new SuccessFactors innovation would be based on MDF and started to migrate some legacy objects to MDF. New modules are built on MDF framework (Time off, time tracking, ONB, Opportunity market place etc) 
  • This is the reason why certain similar objects are built on different frameworks. E.g. Recurring Payment and One‚ÄëTime Payment are built as HRIS Elements whereas Recurring Deduction and One‚ÄëTime Deduction are built as MDF

Original SuccessFactors BizX Talent Module Architecture Diagram

 

2H2025 SuccessFactors BizX Module Architecture Diagram

 

Conclusion: BizX architecture has evolved significantly over the years. The combination of MDF and Business Rules together with Integration Center or CPI is extremely powerful and allows consultants to design highly customized solutions. However, It is a challenge for solution architects to keep in mind the coexistence of so many frameworks and how to design which data built on which framework carefully and holistically. 

A few considerations for design principle:

  • Always try to convince client to keep talent data in background element as talent module can only read background elements
  • There are only 15 custom fields in UDF. Reserve them for talent and IAS usage only. Other modules can directly get from HRIS elements. 
  • BIB/PTP and contingent workers cannot consume background elements. 
  • Using IC/CPI to replicate MDF to the background element or vice versa is technically possible. However, it should be avoided as much as possible. 

 

This article reflects my personal understanding and implementation experience with SAP SuccessFactors. I welcome feedback, challenges, and corrections from fellow consultants.

entry.content:
• 1. Setup
  • 1.1 Installing the required libraries
  • 1.2 Folder structure

  • 1.2.2 unitTests.qunit.html
  • 1.2.3 unitTests.qunit.js

  • 2.2 Simple Test using sinon.stub and sinon.spy
  • 2.3 Testing functions with Return Values or Promises
  • 2.4 Testing error cases and exceptions
  • 2.5 Larger example with more branches
  • 3. Running tests and coverage
  • 3.1 Running tests
  • 3.2 Test results in the QUnit interface
  • 3.3 Enabling code coverage
